Description: Floor and foot sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery plate; white slip; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of griffin to right (forelegs, with added red, breast and part of right wing with added red remaining); at right, rump with added red of undetermined seated animal; incised floral filling ornament; to centre, banding in black, added red and added white; exterior and underside black with added red band between double rings of foot; part of band in added red on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 9a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.712)
